neighbors.name: Parkside At Buckeye HOA
neighbors.claims: Parkside at Buckeye HOA is the homeowners association of a residential community in Buckeye, Arizona ([hoa-resource.com](https://hoa-resource.com/parkside-at-buckeye-homeowners-association-buckeye-az/#:~:text=Parkside%20at%20Buckeye%20HOA%20in,Buckeye%2C%20AZ)). *(Neighbor is an organization; see ORG table for detailed profile.)*

neighbors.name: Enrique Rodriguez
neighbors.claims: Enrique Rodriguez is listed as the owner of a land parcel in the Buckeye area of Maricopa County, Arizona ([www.mcassessor.maricopa.gov](https://www.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/#:~:text=%EF%BB%BF%20Maricopa%20County%20Assessor%27s%20Office)). He holds no known public office or civic position in Buckeye, and no public statements or records were found of him engaging on local development issues ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/elec2/20/elec-BUCKEYE-AZ-20-part5.html#:~:text=2019%20%2F%202020%20Contributions%20Part,5)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a personal, respectful outreach (e.g., a face-to-face meeting) to explain the project and invite Rodriguez to share any concerns or questions.

neighbors.name: Morakod Aphaisuwan & Pimpaporn Tientanawat
neighbors.claims: Morakod Aphaisuwan and Pimpaporn Tientanawat are co-owners of a residential parcel in Buckeye, Arizona, according to Maricopa County property records ([www.mcassessor.maricopa.gov](https://www.mcassessor.maricopa.gov/#:~:text=%EF%BB%BF%20Maricopa%20County%20Assessor%27s%20Office)). They have no public profile in local civic affairs; there is no record of either individual taking a public stance on area development or energy projects ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/elec2/20/elec-BUCKEYE-AZ-20-part5.html#:~:text=2019%20%2F%202020%20Contributions%20Part,5)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage this household through a neighborly approach—introduce the project in simple terms and encourage them to voice any general concerns, building trust through personal communication.

overview_summary: All three neighboring entities have no clearly documented stance on development, with none found to have publicly supported or opposed projects. Community influence appears limited: none of the profiled neighbors hold known leadership roles in the area, and only one (the HOA) represents a broader group.
